intro: Thunia majorensis, commonly known as the Majorcan thunia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Majorca in the Balearic Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species requiring conservation efforts.
